intro: Moritzia dasyantha, commonly known as the hairy moritzia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, palmate leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals, often arranged in clusters. Moritzia dasyantha is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
